description: Evaluation suite for unified search across clients and documents in a wealth management context. Refined for realism.

clients.description: Retired tech executive. High risk tolerance. Matriarch of Jones family.
New client. Entrepreneur. Moderate risk tolerance.
Smith Family Office. Conservative growth. ESG focus.
Entrepreneur. Recently exited startup. Focusing on philanthropy.
Trustee for Chen Global Trust. Intergenerational wealth transfer focus.
Private Equity Partner. Complex tax situation with multiple K-1s.

documents.title: Risk Profile Questionnaire 2024
documents.content:
CLIENT NAME: Sarah Jones
ACCOUNT NUMBER: 8899-1122
DATE: January 15, 2024

SECTION 1: INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES
Q: What is your primary goal?
A: Capital Appreciation. I have sufficient liquidity for living expenses.

SECTION 2: TIME HORIZON
Q: When do you expect to need these funds?
A: 20+ years. This is legacy money for the grandchildren.

SECTION 3: RISK TOLERANCE
Q: If the market drops 20% in a month, what would you do?
A: Buy more. I view volatility as opportunity.

ADVISOR NOTES:
Client is a sophisticated investor (retired tech exec). High tolerance for volatility confirmed. Suitable for Aggressive Growth portfolio.

documents.title: Risk Profile Questionnaire 2024 - Doe
documents.content:
CLIENT NAME: John Doe
DATE: February 1, 2024

RISK TOLERANCE SCORE: 65/100 (Moderate-Growth)

Notes:
Client prefers a balanced approach (60/40 split). Investment horizon is 10-15 years. Primary goal is growth with some income generation.
He is an entrepreneur and has significant risk in his own business, so he prefers his liquid portfolio to be more stable.

documents.title: Smith Family IPS 2023
documents.content:
INVESTMENT POLICY STATEMENT
PREPARED FOR: The Arthur Smith Family Office
DATE: March 10, 2023

1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
The primary objective is capital preservation with conservative growth (CPI + 3%).

2. ASSET ALLOCATION
- Global Equities: 40%
- Fixed Income: 50%
- Cash/Equivalents: 10%

3. LIQUIDITY REQUIREMENTS
The portfolio must generate and distribute $500,000 monthly to the Family Operating Account to cover expenses.

4. INVESTMENT RESTRICTIONS (ESG MANDATE)
The client strictly prohibits investment in companies deriving >5% revenue from:
- Tobacco production or distribution
- Firearms and ammunition
- Fossil fuel extraction (coal, oil sands)

5. BENCHMARK
60% MSCI World / 40% Bloomberg Global Aggregate Bond Index.

documents.title: Q3 2023 Portfolio Review
documents.content:
SMITH FAMILY OFFICE - QUARTERLY REVIEW
Period: July 1 - Sept 30, 2023

PERFORMANCE SUMMARY:
Portfolio Return: +4.2%
Benchmark Return: +3.8%

ALLOCATION CHECK:
Equity: 45% (Overweight)
Fixed Income: 55% (Underweight)
Action: Rebalance recommended.

TOP HOLDINGS:
1. Apple Inc.
2. Microsoft Corp.
3. Tesla Inc.
4. iShares Global Clean Energy ETF

COMPLIANCE CHECK:
No holdings found in restricted sectors (Tobacco, Firearms, Fossil Fuels). Portfolio remains ESG compliant.

documents.title: Meeting Note - Oct 12 2023
documents.content:
ATTENDEES: David Miller (Client), Alex Advisor (RM)
LOCATION: The City Club
DATE: Oct 12, 2023

KEY DISCUSSION POINTS:
1. David mentioned he is seriously considering buying a vineyard in Provence, France next summer (2024). Estimated cost €5-8M.
2. He needs to discuss liquidity options for a €2M down payment by Q2 2024.
3. Expressed concern about his portfolio's overexposure to the Tech sector given his recent startup exit. Wants to diversify into Real Estate or Private Credit.

ACTION ITEMS:
- Prepare liquidity analysis for €2M withdrawal.
- Send research on French luxury property market.

documents.title: Call Summary - Dec 05 2023
documents.content:
CALL LOG
Client: David Miller
Date: Dec 05, 2023
Duration: 15 mins

SUMMARY:
David called regarding his estate planning. His daughter, Emily Miller, is turning 18 in January. He wants to set up a separate educational trust for her.
He asked if we can recommend a trust lawyer in California.

He also confirmed the France property idea is still active.

documents.title: Chen Global Trust - Deed of Settlement
documents.content:
DEED OF SETTLEMENT

THIS DEED OF SETTLEMENT is made on the 1st day of January 2020

BETWEEN:
(1) Li Chen of 123 Park Ave, NY (the "Settlor")
(2) Global Trust Company Ltd (the "Trustee")

WHEREAS the Settlor wishes to establish an irrevocable trust known as THE CHEN GLOBAL TRUST.

BENEFICIARIES:
1. Lucas Chen (Son)
2. Emily Chen (Daughter)
3. Any future lineal descendants of the Settlor.

DISTRIBUTION PROVISIONS:
- Income may be distributed at Trustee discretion.
- Principal shall remain in trust until the respective beneficiary reaches the age of 30.
- Upon reaching age 30, the beneficiary may request up to 50% of their share.
- The remainder shall be distributed at age 35.

documents.title: Last Will and Testament - Li Chen
documents.content:
LAST WILL AND TESTAMENT of LI CHEN

I, Li Chen, residing in New York, NY, being of sound mind, hereby declare this to be my Last Will and Testament.

ARTICLE I: I revoke all prior Wills.

ARTICLE II: I give all my tangible personal property to my spouse, Wei Chen.

ARTICLE III: I give the rest, residue, and remainder of my estate to the Trustee of THE CHEN GLOBAL TRUST, to be added to the trust property and held in accordance with the Trust Deed dated Jan 1, 2020.

Signed this 15th day of March, 2022.
Li Chen
